summary: Comprehensive monthly event log aligned to Wikipedia 2025 coverage; includes politics, conflicts, climate, tech, sports, and culture milestones.

events.event: A powerful M w 6.3 earthquake shakes the provinces of
events.details: A powerful M w 6.3 earthquake shakes the provinces of Balkh and Samangan in Afghanistan , causing 30 deaths and 956 injuries

events.event: At least 14 people are killed, 11 others are injured,
events.details: At least 14 people are killed, 11 others are injured, and 16 are reported missing when a UPS Airlines McDonnell Douglas MD-11 aircraft crashes near Louisville Muhammad Ali International Airport in Kentucky, United States

events.event: Typhoon Kalmaegi leaves more than 206 people dead in the
events.details: Typhoon Kalmaegi leaves more than 206 people dead in the Philippines , Vietnam , and Thailand

events.event: Khaled El-Enany is elected the new Director-General of UNESCO
events.details: Khaled El-Enany is elected the new Director-General of UNESCO

events.event: 21 – The COP30 summit is held in Belém ,
events.details: 21 – The COP30 summit is held in Belém , Brazil , focusing on the role of the Amazon rainforest in climate action

events.event: 2025 Iraqi parliamentary election : Incumbent Prime Minister Mohammed Shia'
events.details: 2025 Iraqi parliamentary election : Incumbent Prime Minister Mohammed Shia' al-Sudani 's party RDC wins a plurality of seats

events.event: The New Glenn rocket booster lands for the first time
events.details: The New Glenn rocket booster lands for the first time

events.event: Former prime minister of Bangladesh Sheikh Hasina is found guilty
events.details: Former prime minister of Bangladesh Sheikh Hasina is found guilty of crimes against humanity by a Bangladeshi tribunal and sentenced to death in absentia

events.event: December 7 – The 2025 FIFA Futsal Women's World Cup
events.details: December 7 – The 2025 FIFA Futsal Women's World Cup is held in the Philippines

events.event: 23 – The G20 Johannesburg summit is held in South
events.details: 23 – The G20 Johannesburg summit is held in South Africa , the first time a G20 summit has been held in Africa
